head.title: Levels of Organization Unit Review and Assessment

body.p: Before taking the quiz below, consider again the learning objectives for this unit on the hierarchical system that we refer to the levels of organization. Could you demonstrate your knowledge of each of these objectives? If so, you will be ready for the assessment. If not, consider reviewing content related to these objectives before attempting the assessment.

li.p: Describe, in order from simplest to most complex, the major levels of organization in the human organism.
Define atoms, molecules and macromolecules and their hierarchical assembly.
Discuss how molecules are composed of atoms through covalent bonds and how different atoms can produce molecules with different physical properties.
Discuss the physiologically important properties of water and how these properties are functions of the molecular structure.
List the four essential macromolecules in physiology. Explain how properties of the substructure relate to the function of the macromolecule.
Describe the structure of DNA and its role in protein synthesis. Discuss how control of DNA expression is related to cell properties.
Describe the four levels of protein structure and discuss the importance of protein structure in function. List and describe different protein functions within different cell types.
Identify mechanisms of carbohydrate processing in metabolism. Describe other roles of carbohydrates in protein and membrane modification.
Describe how amphipathic structures of lipids lead to compartmentalization. Describe how lipids are distributed in a cell membrane.
Define cell. Roughly enumerate the large number of cells and cell types and provide some examples of how cells differ based on function.
List the roles of membranes in cellular physiology. Describe processes by which cells compartmentalize material for exchange intracellularly and intercellularly.
List the major organelles of the cell and state the associated function(s). Roughly enumerate the organelles per cell. Synthesize ideas regarding differential organelle number in specialized cells.
Define cellular respiration and describe the mechanisms of metabolism.
Describe physiological events that would lead to cellular proliferation. List the steps of mitosis and cytokinesis and identify key cellular features related to the steps of proliferation.
Define apoptosis and necrosis and describe the cellular processes associated with each. Provide examples of where apoptosis and necrosis occur in physiology.
Define tissue. List the four major tissue types and organ systems associated with each.
Define organ. Discuss the organ level within the larger hierarchy of human physiology.
Define organ system. Discuss how the organ systems work together in the whole body and how the body interacts with the environment to impact physiology.
